intro: Lepidagathis palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
